Detailed Description

A Control has a frame and a client area, which is the area inside the frame. A control can have one or more sub controls and drawable objects, which are only visible inside the client area of the control. The sub controls themselves can recursively have other sub controls.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from Component.

enum Control::FrameType
 

Every control can have a different frame type. The look of a frame type is implemented in the instance of a ControlFrameView, which can be retrieved from the current set Theme by the factory-method Control::GetFrameView().

Enumerator:
NoFrame  The size of each border is zero, hence the client area of the control is equivalent to the bounding-rectangle of the control.
DefaultFrame  The size of the borders is equivalent to the sizes given by the instance of ControlFrameView. A frame of the type DefaultFrame has a different look when the control has the focus.
StaticFrame  In opposite to DefaultFrame the look of the frame is independent from having the focus. This frame type is useful for e. g. editors or list boxes, where the cursor indicates the focus.
DynamicFrame  Is meant for frames where the control dynamically changes the size of the client area during runtime.

Member Function Documentation

void Control::AddControl (  Control *  control,
BOOLEAN  at_end = TRUE
) 
 

Adds a sub control to the control. This method is automatically invoked when initializing a sub control by it's constructor or Control::Init. All sub controls are automatically drawn.

Parameters:
control Pointer to the sub control.
at_end If set to TRUE, the control is appended after all other controls. Otherwise the control is inserted at the begin. The order only matters when having overlapping controls.

void Control::AddDrawableObject (  DrawableObject *  drawable_object,
BOOLEAN  at_end = TRUE
) 
 

Adds a drawable object to the control. This method is automatically invoked when initializing a drawable object by it's constructor or DrawableObject::Init. All drawable objects are automatically drawn by Control::OnPaint()

Parameters:
component Pointer to the drawable object.
at_end If set to TRUE, the drawable object is appended after all other drawable objects. Otherwise the drawable object is inserted at the begin. The order only matters when having overlapping drawable objects.
See also:
Control::OnPaint()

void Control::Cleanup (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked, when the control gets invisible e. g. when the parent-window which contains the control is closed. Invokes Component::Cleanup of all sub-components.

Reimplemented from Component.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, Menu, AbstractEditor, AbstractItemGrid, ContextMenu, ItemMenu, and ItemTree.

BOOLEAN Control::ContainsControl (  const Control *  control  )  const
 

Returns TRUE, if the control control is embedded as sub control.

BOOLEAN Control::ContainsDrawableObject (  const DrawableObject *  obj  )  const
 

Returns TRUE, if the drawable object obj is embedded into the control.

void Control::Draw (   ) 
 

Draws the control including its sub components. Reimplement the method Control::OnPaint for drawing the client area and reimplement the method ControlFrameView::DrawControlFrame of the corresponding theme for drawing the control frame. It is possible to draw a layer above the whole content by reimplementing Control::DrawLayer.

void Control::DrawLayer (   )  [virtual]
 

Is invoked by Control::Draw and allows to draw a layer above the already drawn control. For example it would be possible to dimm the whole control by drawing an alpha blended filled rectangle this way: 

void MyControl::DrawLayer()
{
    FrameDc dc(this);
    dc.BeginUpdate();
    dc.SetBrushColorRgb(0, 0, 0, 128);
    dc.FillRect(0, 0, GetWidth() - 1, GetHeight() - 1);
    dc.EndUpdate();
}

XYDIM Control::GetClientHeight (   )  const
 

Returns:
Height of the client area.

Rect Control::GetClientRect (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
Bounding-rectangle of the client area. Can be overwritten for derived controls, which need a modified client-Area, like e. g. a Window which has a title and a softkey-bar. Note that all non-virtual GetClient-methods use this method to return their corresponding parameters. Hence from an economic point of view it is more efficient to invoke GetClientRect() instead of invoking GetClientXPos(), GetClientYPos(), GetClientWidth() and GetClientHeight() when needing all four parameters.

Reimplemented in GridLayout, and Window.

Size Control::GetClientSize (   )  const
 

Returns:
Size of the client area.

Returns:
Width of the client area.

XYDIM Control::GetClientXPos (   )  const
 

Returns:
x-position of client area relative to upper left edge of the control.

XYDIM Control::GetClientYPos (   )  const
 

Returns:
y-position of client area relative to upper left edge of the control.

Component * Control::GetComponent (  INT  id  )  const
 

Returns a pointer to the sub-component with the ID id. Each component generated by Aragon has a unique ID which can be retrieved by Component::GetId. If the component has not been generated by Aragon, -1 is returned as default ID.

Parameters:
id ID of the sub-component which should be returned. If -1 is used, 0 is returned.
Returns:
Pointer to the sub-component with the given ID. 0 is returned if the ID is -1 or no sub-component has an equal ID.

const ClientDc * Control::GetDeviceContext (   )  const
 

Returns:
Pointer to the device context of the client area.

ClientDc * Control::GetDeviceContext (   ) 
 

Returns a pointer to the device context of the client area. Note that this device-context is shared by all controls which are drawn on the same display. Hence it is recommended to use the class PaintDc before modifying the device-context.

INT Control::GetDisplayIndex (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the index of the display, where the Window should be drawn.

Control* Control::GetFirstControl (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns a pointer to the first sub control of the control. The following sub controls are accessable by Control::GetNext().

See also:
ComponentIterator

DrawableObject* Control::GetFirstDrawableObject (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns a pointer to the first drawable-object of the control. The following drawable objects are accessable by DrawableObject::GetNext().

See also:
ComponentIterator

Control * Control::GetFocusedControl (   )  const
 

Returns the focused sub control of the control (0, if the control has no sub controls). If the control itself has not the focus, also no sub control can have the focus and 0 is returned.

Control * Control::GetForegroundControl (   )  const
 

Obsolete - use Control::GetFirstControl instead or Control::GetFocusedControl. GetForegroundControl returns the first control for backward compatibility.

FrameType Control::GetFrameType (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
Type of frame (NoFrame, DefaultFrame or StaticFrame).

const ControlFrameView * Control::GetFrameView (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Factory-method for getting the frame-view of the control. Per default, the ControlFrameView from the current set Theme is used.

Reimplemented in Window.

INT Control::GetInternalDisplayIndex (   )  const [inline, protected]
 

Obsolete - use Control::GetDisplayIndex() instead.

INT Control::GetLanguageId (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the language ID which is used for the control.

Control* Control::GetLastFocusedChild (   )  const [inline, protected]
 

Obsolete - use Control::GetLastFocusedControl() instead.

Control* Control::GetLastFocusedControl (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the sub control which had the focus before the control lost it's focus. As soon as the control will gain the focus, this sub control will get the focus too.

NavigationGuidance Control::GetNavigationGuidance (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
The navigation guidance, which can be used to e. g. display the available navigation keys between the softkeys as indication for the user.

Control * Control::GetNext (  const Control *  control  )  const
 

Returns the successor of the sub control control. 0 is returned if no successor is available, which usually means that only one sub control is embedded.

Control* Control::GetNext (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the next control of the sub control queue. In combination with Control::GetFirstControl() it is possible to iterate over all sub controls. Note that there also exists the iterator ComponentIterator, which allows to iterate over all sub components.

Window * Control::GetParentWindow (   )  const
 

Returns:
Pointer to the first parent-control, which is an instance of the class Window. It is assured, that at least the root-control is an instance of the class Window.

Control * Control::GetPrevious (  Control *  control  )  const
 

Returns the predecessor of the sub control control. 0 is returned if no predecessor is available, which usually means that only one sub control is embedded.

const Rect& Control::GetRepaintRect (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the invalidated rectangle of the control which should get repainted. The rectangle is relative to the upper left corner of the control frame.

MsgId Control::GetTriggeredMessage (  InputMapId  map_id,
const InputMapItem &  input_map_item
)  const [protected]
 

Obsolete - provided for backward compatibility with older APOXI releases. The method is required for the (obsolete) input map concept (see Control::OnInputMap).

BOOLEAN Control::GrabFocus (   ) 
 

Tries to grab the focus for the control.

Returns:
TRUE is returned, if the control will get the focus. Note that the focus will be assigned asynchronously and is not assigned immediately after invoking Control::GrabFocus. See also Control::OnGetFocus for details. FALSE is returned, if either the parent-control does not have the focus or if the control cannot get the focus because a window with a higher focus-priority currently has the focus.

BOOLEAN Control::HasFocus (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
TRUE, if the control has the focus. Having the focus means, that all messages of the type MC_FOCUS are routed to this control only.

void Control::Init (  Control *  parent = 0,
const View *  view = 0
) 
 

Parameters:
parent Pointer to parent control, which includes the control as child.
view Pointer to the view of the control.

void Control::Invalidate (  const Rect &  rect,
BOOLEAN  erase = TRUE
) 
 

Invalidates a specified area of the control. This leads to a repaint of this area in the next idle-state of the application.

Parameters:
rect Specifies the area by a rectangle. The coordinates are relative to the upper left position of the control. If no rectangle is specified, the whole area will be invalidated.
erase Indicates, whether the control should be erased before Control::OnPaint is called. By default erase is TRUE.

Reimplemented in CalendarGrid.

void Control::Invalidate (   ) 
 

Wrapper for Control::Invalidate(Rect(), TRUE) (no default parameters are used to reduce the code size).

void Control::InvalidateClient (  const Rect &  rect,
BOOLEAN  erase = TRUE
) 
 

Invalidates the client area of the control. This leads to a repaint of this area in the next idle-state of the application.

Parameters:
rect Specifies the area by a rectangle. The coordinates are relative to the client area of the control. If no rectangle is specified, the whole are will be invalidated.
erase Indicates, whether the control should be erased before Control::OnPaint is called. By default erase is TRUE.

void Control::InvalidateClient (   ) 
 

Wrapper for Control::InvalidateClient(Rect(), TRUE) (no default parameters are used to reduce the code size).

BOOLEAN Control::IsAutoClearEnabled (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if auto-clearing of the client area is enabled.

See also:
SetAutoClearEnabled

BOOLEAN Control::IsAutoLayoutEnabled (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if auto-layouting of sub-components is enabled. Per default the auto-layouting is enabled.

See also:
SetAutoLayoutEnabled

BOOLEAN Control::IsChild (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the control is embedded into a parent control.

BOOLEAN Control::IsDisabled (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
TRUE, if the control is disabled and hence gets no messages from the type MC_FOCUS.
See also:
Control::SetDisabled()

BOOLEAN Control::IsInForeground (   )  const
 

Returns:
TRUE, if the control is on foreground related to controls being at the same level hierarchy. E. g. a child control may be on foreground related to other child controls inside the parent, but the parent control must not be on foreground. When a Control has the focus, it is always in the foreground.

Reimplemented in Window.

BOOLEAN Control::IsParentWindowOpen (   )  const
 

Returns:
TRUE, if the first parent-control which is an instance of the class Window is open. Note that it is assured, that at least one parent of a control is an instance of the class Window, which can be opened or closed.

void Control::LayoutClient (   ) 
 

Leads to a relayout of the client area by invoking OnLayoutClient. Additionally the drawing-performance is optimized by invoking OptimizeAutoClear.

void Control::Maximize (   )  [virtual]
 

Maximizes the Control to the size of the display if it has no parent, otherwise it is maximized to the client area of the parent. The frame-border is outside the visible area, title and softkey-bar are fully visible. The control will stay maximized until the position or the size will be changed.

Reimplemented in Window.

void Control::OnFocusNextControl (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if the focus will be switched to the next control inside the control.

Reimplemented in FlowLayout, GridLayout, and TabControl.

void Control::OnFocusPreviousControl (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if the focus will be switched to the previous control inside the control.

Reimplemented in FlowLayout, GridLayout, and TabControl.

void Control::OnGetFocus (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if the control gets the focus. When a Control has the focus, all messages of the type MC_FOCUS are forwarded to this Control.

Reimplemented in AbstractPredictiveInputBox, AtlWindow, AtlItemGridWindow, AbstractEditBox, CheckBox, EditBox, AbstractEditor, AbstractGrid, AbstractItemGrid, AbstractMultiLineEditor, GridLayout, Window, BtAvrcpControllerDeviceListWindow, BtAvrcpDeviceListWin, CalendarGrid, SmsEditor, SmsViewerWin, and UibFolderWin.

Reimplemented in AbstractEditBox, AbstractListBox, AbstractMenuList, CheckBox, EditBox, Grid, CalendarGrid, and CalendarMonthSelector.

BOOLEAN Control::OnKeyAutoRepeat (  KeyCode  key_code  )  [protected, virtual]
 

If one key is pressed permanently this method is called periodically corresponding to the set autorepeat value.

Parameters:
Code of the key.

Reimplemented in AbstractGrid, and GridLayout.

BOOLEAN Control::OnKeyDown (  KeyCode  key_code  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if a key has been pressed and is still holded.

Parameters:

Returns:
TRUE, if the key-down message has been dispatched and hence should not be routed to other windows anymore.

void Control::OnLayoutClient (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if the client area should be layouted (e. g. when the control is initialized or the size of the client area has changed). The use of the class Layouter for layouting the controls is recommended.

See also:
Layouter

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, T9PredictiveInputBox, Zi8PredictiveInputBox, AtlLabelListWindow, AbstractListBox, TextList, AbstractGrid, AbstractMultiLineEditor, FlowLayout, GridLayout, MessageBox, Panel, TabControl, Window, EmsComposeWin, SmsComposeWin, SmsViewerWin, ImageBrowserDetailWin, and SavingProgressWin.

void Control::OnPaint (  const Rect &  repaint_rect  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if the control must be repainted. A repainting is always triggered by a Control::Invalidate. Note that the repainting is not done immediately after a Control::Invalidate, but when entering the next idle-state. Hence if an update of the display is needed before entering the idle-state, <em<Application::UpdateDisplay must be invoked.

Parameters:
@see Control::Invalidate()
See also:
Application::UpdateDisplay()

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AbstractListBox, AbstractEditor, AbstractGrid, AbstractItemGrid, AbstractMultiLineEditor, and Alert.

XYDIM  dy
)  [protected, virtual]

void Control::OptimizeAutoClear (   )  [protected]
 

Tries to to disable auto-clearing of the client area, when a sub control completely fills the client area.

void Control::PutToForeground (   ) 
 

Puts the control to the foreground and assigns the focus.

See also:
IsInForeground()

void Control::Refresh (  const Rect &  rect  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked, before the control gets visible e. g. when the parent-window which contains the control is opened. Invokes Component::Refresh of all sub-components.

Reimplemented from Component.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AbstractEditBox, AbstractListBox, CheckBox, CheckBoxList, Grid, Menu, MenuList, RadioButtonList, TextList, AbstractEditor, AbstractGrid, AbstractItemGrid, AbstractMultiLineEditor, CheckBoxControl, ContextMenu, DateEditor, ItemMenu, ItemTree, PushButton, RadioButtonControl, TabButton, TabControl, and Window.

void Control::RemoveControl (  Control *  control  ) 
 

Removes a sub control from the control, hence it is not drawn anymore and cannot get the focus.

void Control::RemoveDrawableObject (  DrawableObject *  drawable_object  ) 
 

Removes a drawable object from the control, hence it is not drawn anymore in Control::OnPaint().

Parameters:
component Pointer to the drawable object.
See also:
Control::OnPaint()

BOOLEAN Control::RouteMessage (  const Message &  msg  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Implements the message routing of controls. It is recommended not to change the default message routing and usually it should not be necessary.

See also:
Dispatcher::RouteMessage

Reimplemented from Dispatcher.

Reimplemented in T9PredictiveInputBox, and Zi8PredictiveInputBox.

void Control::SetAutoClearEnabled (  BOOLEAN  enabled  ) 
 

Per default the client area of a control is automatically cleared before invoking OnPaint. This can be turned off be setting enabled to FALSE. This is useful when e. g. the drawing of the client area is done synchronously outside the context of OnPaint.

void Control::SetAutoLayoutEnabled (  BOOLEAN  enabled  )  [inline]
 

If enabled is TRUE, the control automatically layouts a sub control inside the client area. This is only done, if exactly one sub control is part of the control. If more than one sub control has been added, the layouting must be done by overwriting the method Control::OnLayoutClient or by using a LayouterControl as wrapper. Per default the automatical layouting of one sub control is enabled.

See also:
Layouter

LayouterControl

void Control::SetDisabled (  BOOLEAN  disabled  ) 
 

Marks the control as disabled, if disabled is TRUE. A control which is disabled does not treat messages of the type MC_FOCUS, even if the Control is focused. Hence all the sub controls do not get this messages too. This is useful when e. g. reading out a large provider in Window::OnOpen() and the interaction with the user should be disabled until the reading of the provider has been finished.

BOOLEAN Control::SetDisplayIndex (  INT  index  ) 
 

Sets the index of the display, where the Control should be drawn. The number of displays can be specified in DisplayConfig::GetDisplayCount().

Returns:
TRUE, if the change of the display-index has been successful. Note that it is not possible to change the display-index of a child-control to an index, which is different to the index of its parent-control.

void Control::SetFrameType (  FrameType  frame_type  )  [inline]
 

Parameters:
frame_type Type of frame (NoFrame,DefaultFrame or StaticFrame). The look and size of the frame is defined by the corresponding instance of ControlFrameView of the current Theme.
See also:
Theme::GetControlFrameView()

Theme::GetWindowFrameView()

void Control::SetInternalDisplayIndex (  INT  index  )  [inline, protected]
 

Allows derived classed to set the display index property without reattaching the control.

void Control::SetLastFocusedChild (  Control *  control  )  [inline, protected]
 

Obsolete - use Control::SetLastFocusedControl() instead.

void Control::SetLastFocusedControl (  Control *  control  )  [inline, protected]
 

Allows derived classes to let the control remember the sub control which should get the focus when the control itself will get the focus.

void Control::SetNavigationGuidance (  NavigationGuidance  navigation_guidance  ) 
 

Sets the navigation guidance, which usually will be shown between the softkeys. Note that APOXI updates the navigation guidance for the up- and down-keys automatically when the methods Control::AddControl and Control::RemoveControlare invoked. The policy in this case is that the up- and down-keys get enabled if at least 2 sub controls are part of the control, otherwise they get disabled (the up- and down-keys are the default keys for switching the focus between sub controls). As entry point for initializing the navigation guidance Control::OnGetFocus is recommended. See also Control::GetNavigationGuidance for details.

void Control::SetNext (  Control *  next  )  [inline]
 

Sets the next control for the sub control queue. It should not be necessary for an application to use this method directly.

void Control::SetParent (  Control *  parent  )  [virtual]
 

See also:

BOOLEAN Control::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.
